str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To outrage, maltreat, corrupt, defile. Middle voice from a probably derivative of luo; properly, to soil, i.e. insult.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To journey in(to), I go in(to), enter, intervene. From eis and poreuomai; to enter.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To draw, drag, force away. Probably akin to haireomai; to trail.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.
